publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3391 Mr John McAllion: Mary Slessor Foundation-That the Parliament welcomes the work of the Mary Slessor Foundation in continuing the work done in Calabar, Nigeria, by Mary Slessor of Dundee in the 19th century; notes the excellent work being done by the foundation to defeat poverty and disease in Nigeria, and further welcomes this commemoration of Mary Slessor and the encouragement of links between Scotland and Africa.
S1M-3391 Mary Slessor Foundation (lodged on 16 September 2002) Alex Neil*
S1M-3391 Mary Slessor Foundation (lodged on 16 September 2002) Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-3391 Mr John McAllion: Mary Slessor Foundation-That the Parliament welcomes the work of the Mary Slessor Foundation in continuing the work done in Calabar, Nigeria, by Mary Slessor of Dundee in the 19th century; notes the excellent work being done by the foundation to defeat poverty and disease in Nigeria, and further welcomes this commemoration of Mary Slessor and the encouragement of links between Scotland and Africa. Supported by: Alex Neil, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Tommy Sheridan
S1M-3391 Mary Slessor Foundation (lodged on 16 September 2002) Scott Barrie*
S1M-3391 Mary Slessor Foundation (lodged on 16 September 2002) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-3391 Mary Slessor Foundation (lodged on 16 September 2002) Shona Robison*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-3391 Mary Slessor Foundation (lodged on 16 September 2002) Helen Eadie*
S1M-3391 Mary Slessor Foundation (lodged on 16 September 2002) Roseanna Cunningham*, Cathy Peattie*
S1M-3391 Mary Slessor Foundation (lodged on 16 September 2002) Linda Fabiani*
S1M-3391 Mary Slessor Foundation (lodged on 16 September 2002) Ms Sandra White*
S1M-3391 Mary Slessor Foundation (lodged on 16 September 2002) Brian Fitzpatrick*
S1M-3391 Mary Slessor Foundation (lodged on 16 September 2002) Susan Deacon*
S1M-3391 Mary Slessor Foundation (lodged on 16 September 2002) Mr Gil Paterson*
